post_text: December 23, 2020 at 11:57 PM#1I'm sure this is simple, but I've searched and can't find the syntax.I'm assigning a group via "Assign Group 5 At Executor 10.2" and I want to specify the Mode as Additive - by default it's set to Positive.Thanks!

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: December 24, 2020 at 10:27 PM#2after assigning the group to the executor, you change the mode of the executor via:Assign Executor 10.2 /Mode=Additive

posts.author: johnF
posts.post_text: December 25, 2020 at 3:26 PM#3Just tested -- works great!  <curtsey> -- thank you so much!I was close purely by random attempts.  I'd added "Mode = Additive" to the end but the interpreter was changing "Mode" to "Model" ([Oops] to the rescue).  Also tried "/m=additive", "/m=3", "/mode=3", etc.  Your help is awesome!By the way, is this in the manual and if so can you point me to it?  I searched for "mode" and "additive", read the "Group masters" section and went through the "Command Syntax and Keywords" but never saw it or missed it. <shrug> In "Executor Keyword" (in "Command Syntax and Keywords") I see "Assign Executor [ID] /[Parameter] = [Parameter Value]" but "Mode" isn't listed.At any rate, thanks again on behalf of me, my head, and the wall I was banging it against!
